trans-unit.source: Collects the characteristics associated with flow layouts.
The FlowLayoutSettings class collects and manages the characteristics associated with the flow layout scheme.
This class is used internally by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip> classes, as well as the flow layout engine.
The FlowLayoutSettings class is used by the layout engine to determine how to layout the container's child controls.
The FlowLayoutSettings class manages the following information: - The flow direction of consecutive controls.
- Whether the contents should be wrapped or clipped if the child controls cannot be contained within their parent.
FlowLayoutSettings does not have a public constructor.
Gets or sets a value indicating the flow direction of consecutive controls.
FlowDirection is the default property for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutSettings> class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowDirection"></xref> indicating the flow direction of consecutive controls in the container.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlowDirection"></xref>.
Returns a value that represents the flow break setting of the control.
The child control.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the flow break is set; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the current flow layout engine.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutSettings.LayoutEngine%2A> property is typically used in two contexts: - A container that uses a flow layout.
- A control contained within a flow layout container (for example, a button contained in a cell of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlowLayoutPanel>).
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine"></xref> currently being used.
Sets the value that represents the flow break setting of the control.
The child control.
The flow break value to set.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents should be wrapped or clipped when they exceed the original boundaries of their container.
If the area of the container is too small to display all the child controls, then at least one control will be clipped regardless of the WrapContents value.
Subsequent resizing of the container will reapply the layout to the contained controls.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the contents should be wrapped; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the contents should be clipped.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
